summary: This FBI 302 document records a July 8, 2019, phone call from an anonymous informant to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Eastern District of New York. The caller, who claims a long-term association with Jeffrey Epstein, provides detailed allegations of sexual abuse, videotaping, and potential murders on Epstein's island, while also asserting Epstein has powerful protectors.

persons.name: Todd
persons.context: The anonymous caller who contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office, claiming to have been a friend of Jeffrey Epstein since his teens and to have attended his 'circuit parties.' He alleges knowledge of abuse, videotaping, and disappearances.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the investigation. The caller describes him as hosting drunken orgies, videotaping sex acts, being dangerous, and having powerful protectors.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned by the caller as someone he once worked for, establishing a potential political connection.

persons.name: Hillary Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned by the caller as someone he once worked for, establishing a potential political connection.

persons.name: Zoe
persons.context: Described by the caller as Epstein's 'brute of a bodyguard, a Jamaican named Zoe.'

persons.name: Jan Hewitt
persons.context: Listed as the contact name for the phone company (Onvoy, LLC) associated with the phone number left by the anonymous caller.

connections.description: Caller claims to have been a friend of Epstein since he was 16 or 17 years old and attended his parties for decades.
Caller claims to have once worked for Bill Clinton.
Caller claims to have once worked for Hillary Clinton.
Zoe is described as Epstein's bodyguard.
Caller alleges Epstein's 'circuit parties' were attended by politicians, judges, and law enforcement officials, implying protective relationships.

events.title: Anonymous Tip to EDNY
events.description: An anonymous individual calls the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Eastern District of New York, providing detailed allegations about Jeffrey Epstein's activities, including abuse, videotaping, and potential murders.

events.title: Epstein's Circuit Parties
events.description: The caller describes a period from the 1980s to ~2012 where Epstein hosted 'drunken orgies' or 'circuit parties' attended by powerful figures, where young people were given liquor and engaged in videotaped sex acts.

events.title: Disappearance of Runaway Women
events.description: The caller alleges knowledge of at least a dozen young runaway women who complained of abuse on Epstein's island and were then taken away by boat and never seen again.

events.title: Squashed Florida Civil Suit
events.description: The caller references a civil suit against Epstein in Florida that was allegedly squashed, indicating interference in legal proceedings.

locations: Central Islip office of the US Attorney's Office, Eastern District of New York (EDNY)
Epstein's island in the British Virgin Islands
Odessa, FL (location associated with caller's phone number)
keyFacts: An anonymous caller with claimed long-term ties to Epstein alleges the existence of a cache of videos documenting sex acts with politicians, judges, and law enforcement officials.
The caller alleges at least a dozen young runaway women who complained of abuse on Epstein's island were taken away by boat and never seen again.
The caller asserts Epstein has a 'chokehold on half of the state of Florida' and that powerful people protect him to save their careers.
The caller specifically vouches for the credibility of an alleged victim, stating she 'is not lying.'
The document includes a reverse phone lookup trace for the number left by the caller, linking it to a landline in Odessa, Florida.
